posts.name: Sasha Weiss
posts.cooked:
Today, we’re releasing version 7.41 to beta. If you’re interested in participating, join the beta group .

Release notes:

  • This update includes support for the new telephone number format in Benin.

Let us know about any issues you experience! Thank you for being a beta tester!

link_counts.title: Beta feedback for the upcoming iOS 7.40 release

posts.cooked:
New Version: 7.41.0.499-beta

75 new commits since 7.40.0.490-beta (+ 1 commit omitted):

Show commits

  • Bump version to 7.41 [1]

  • Delete TSAttachment managers and other intermediaries [2]

  • Remove TSResource/Stream/Pointer/Thumbnail, use v2 types directly instead [3]

  • Remove TSResourceReference, use v2 types directly instead [4]

  • Sayonara, TSResource [5]

  • Clean up some TSAttachment-adjacent code [6]

  • Drop TSAttachment fields from JobRecords [7]

  • Deprecate attachmentIds TSInteraction column [8]

  • Arrivederci, TSAttachment [9]

  • Adios, MediaGalleryRecord [10]

  • Final ezpz TSAttachment cleanups [11]

  • Thread merge MessageAttachmentReferences [12]

  • Exclusively use the new linked device view [13]

  • Support presenting device linking from chat list camera [14]

  • Don't fail when unable to read quote image in TSAttachment migration [15]

  • Make loadCallRecordsAnew async [16]

  • Fix issue where we skipped backing up expiring messages with unstarted timers [17]

  • Include expiring messages in deviceTransfer backups [18]

  • Make Backup subscription redemption durable [19]

  • Reduce memory usage of TSAttachment migration [20]

  • Include app version in backup error display [21]

  • Convert incoming messages from self into outgoing messages in backup export [22]

  • Add OWSProgress for be used for backup progress tracking [23]

  • Add OWSProgress utility to periodically update with a task and estimated completion time [24]

  • Use OWSProgress in MessageBackupManager [25]

  • Use theme color for LoadingViewController label [26]

  • Report link'n'sync export errors to linked device via server endpoint [27]

  • Make NameEditorViewController from EditCallLinkNameViewController [28]

  • Protocolize and asyncify OWSDevicesService [29]

  • When deleting attachment references, filter by idInOwner [30]

  • Allow linked device names to be edited [31]

  • Update libsignal to 0.64.1 [32]

  • Use UInt64 instead of UInt32 for OWSProgress [33]

  • [Quick Restore] Add new QR code screen for registration [34]

  • Link'n'Sync progress modal on primary devices [35]

  • Update to RingRTC v2.49.0. [36]

  • Ensure device stays awake during link'n'sync [37]

  • Disallow restoring from a backup twice [38]

  • Use HEAD request to peek attachment download size [39]

  • Add incoming support for DeviceNameChange sync messages [40]

  • Add Link'n'Sync secondary device progress view [41]

  • Add Link'n'Sync primary device failure sheet [42]

  • Use OWSProgress in Attachment Upload and Download Managers [43]

  • Update backup proto and integration tests [44]

  • Fix Pods submodule pointer [45]

  • Add Link'n'Sync error prompts to secondary devices [46]

  • Rotate the provisioning QR code every 45s [47]

  • Block link'n'sync device sleep on main actor [48]

  • Clean up some more phone number parsing code [49]

  • Fix some countryCode/callingCode confusion [50]

  • Rename callingCode method [51]

  • Reformat some change number view controller code [52]

  • Make the raw phone number parsing method private [53]

  • Update phone number confirmation copy [54]

  • Remove redundant parsing calls when given an e164 [55]

  • Remove duplicate dual-country parsing logic [56]

  • Reuse registration parsing logic for change number [57]

  • Improve default country code selection logic [58]

  • Rename “phone number” to “national number” [59]

  • Move RegistrationCountryState → PhoneNumberCountry [60]

  • Use libPhoneNumber to parse calling codes [61]

  • Don’t populate the default country code repeatedly [62]

  • Migrate RegistrationCoordinatorTest to SwiftTesting [63]

  • Parse phone numbers using country codes [64]

  • Update libPhoneNumber-unsupported country codes [65]

  • Simplify & consolidate example phone numbers [66]

  • Update libPhoneNumber metadata to 8.13.51 [67]

  • Look up both Benin phone number formats [68]

  • Look up both Argentinian number formats [69]

  • Fix Mexico number contraction handling [70]

  • Update to SQLCipher v4.6.1 [71]

  • Don't fail TSAttachment migration on quoted reply validation errors [72]

  • Update release notes [73]

  • Update translations [74]

  • Handle landscape and portrait layouts in provisioning QR code [75]

posts.name: Sasha Weiss
posts.cooked:
FYI to all, we’ve decided to release 7.41 to production ahead of schedule as part of a hotfixing effort. Since the intended release note for 7.41 was not yet localized, we’ll be re-using the prior release notes:

  • Fans of big emotions (or emoji) will be happy to hear that a small space or line break between two emoji characters will no longer prevent those emoji from appearing in their jumbo form.
  • We also fixed a bug that sometimes caused the tab bar to cover the text input field, and another one that caused edited attachments to appear in the media gallery multiple times — so now you can change the past without feeling like you’re repeating it.

Please also note that 7.41 is the last planned release before the winter holidays, as our team will be out of office for much of the upcoming weeks! We plan to cut our next beta in the new year, when we’re all back at our computers.

Thanks so much for being beta testers; we couldn’t do this without you. See you in the new year.

Lkunited:

Continuing the discussion from the last thread @harry-signal:
Previous post

The files were a mix of 8 JPG photos and 6 H.264 compressed videos. If I select a single one of them, Signal recognizes the file correctly, but when trying to share all files, Signal still says it would be 4 documents:

IMG_62111179×1354 141 KB

This one is still there.

DebugLogs

Re-registering push notifications usually fixes it.

Signal Support

Troubleshooting Notifications

Android iOS Desktop Note: Notifications for reactions will only appear if you choose to display Name and message in the notification. Manage this option in Signal Settings > Notifications. ma...

posts.name: Daniel
posts.cooked:
Hi,

my settings are correct and everything was what needs to be. You are right maybe the Registering in the Signal settings under notifications is a point. But i have had the same with my friend and he is a android User. But my message couldn‘t get delivered to him, i must send him a SMS and must noticed him that he gets a message from me. He told me on his android phone in the Signal settings there is not a button for push registrations. But how many people will think about that and are willing to push a button to manuell registering to get push notifications. Or maybe it‘s on apples site or maybe some kind of virus that‘s blocking the Delivery. To speak about that is important because we all want that Signal Users will stay because Signal is the best Messaging App.

posts.name: Croissant
posts.cooked:
@dandoe This is 99.9% of the time due to aggressive and crap battery saving mode for background apps on Android that’s enabled for almost all apps by default.

In the Android settings, within Apps menu - or app settings, basically wherever you can change any battery related setting for apps, as every version of Android is different - you have to disallow the system to put Signal to sleep in the background.

dandoe:

He told me on his android phone in the Signal settings there is not a button for push registrations.

Because there isn’t. Per the page I linked, that’s only on iOS.

For Android it’s a bit different, but the troubleshooting steps are on the exact same page I linked previously:

Signal Support

Troubleshooting Notifications

Android iOS Desktop Note: Notifications for reactions will only appear if you choose to display Name and message in the notification. Manage this option in Signal Settings > Notifications. ma...

posts.name: Xashyar
posts.cooked:
Transferring data to a new phone, is taking very long 4 hours!

signal-2024-12-16-04-32-48-8981024×2228 71.6 KB

Is this normal procedure?

Update: https://debuglogs.org/ios/7.41.0/3e91d747a0892d6420923510576972792418538d1dc0caa725093e811f54cd60.zip

It took 1 h for me.

20 characters

posts.name: H
posts.cooked: If proxy is enabled, edited messages are not being delivered.

posts.name: Harry Sanabria
posts.cooked:
Thank you for the details! Getting back to this now after debugging the more serious crash-on-launch issue other users were experiencing.

Hmmm unfortunately it’s difficult to diagnose the sharing action itself, but something that caught my attention was you mentioning you can’t forward the images/videos in-app and therefore went through the sharesheet instead. The only thing that would prevent forwarding is if any of the files failed to download or if the encrypted file was corrupted or did not match the signature from the sender.

Do you know if all the files successfully downloaded and can be viewed in-app? Were these files you received from another Signal user, and if so do you know if they sent them from Signal iOS vs Android vs Desktop? I think the sharesheet issue might be caused by a deeper issue with one or more of the files themselves.

harry-signal:

Do you know if all the files successfully downloaded and can be viewed in-app?

Yes, I can view all of them.

harry-signal:

Were these files you received from another Signal user, and if so do you know if they sent them from Signal iOS vs Android vs Desktop?

Should also be iOS.

harry-signal:

but something that caught my attention was you mentioning you can’t forward the images/videos in-app and therefore went through the sharesheet instead

Now, forwarding is available, but the Sharesheet issue is still there.

More DebugLogs, if they are of any use

posts.name: Harry Sanabria
posts.cooked: Alright I’ve got a speculative fix for you; not sure if it will completely fix it but it should help. I’m not sure if it will go out in 7.41 but if it doesn’t it will definitely be in 7.42. Thanks for reporting!

posts.cooked: Thank you very much.
